channel.title: Framework
channel.description:
Well I was bored and decided to create a framework and its extremely shitty but it was worth a shot. Just standard IO. Only made this for learning purposes not planning to use it. Referenced a few things. Everything except for Stream, ISAACCipher and some of the login protocol was created by me.
When a player connects and passes through the gateway, a new client object is created and sent to the reactor engine where it is added too a queue and every 150ms the queue is polled and each client is logged in. I honestly have/had no clue what I was doing, so that design is probably retarded in itself.
Although, I did get a successful login :)
[IMG]http://i891.photobucket.com/albums/ac113/zezimo52/login_zps579f4d16.png[/img]
There are two problems though. One being, it always reads the username and password as null. I'll probably figure this out by myself.
And two being its really inconsistent. By this I mean sometimes it logs in, sometimes it doesn't (which is weird). I have also noticed it connects three times before anything is actually done, which is again weird. Honestly, I think that problem is probably just from the shitty overall design of this. Oh well, I'm learning :)
source: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/2myxe3ruooj0wk8/mTdwEsHiVK
Discussion:
What can I do to improve this?
Why is the design bad, and a solution to the bad design?
It would really be helpful if someone did a rundown on I/O streams. Only thing that really confuses me at this point.
idk maybe people can learn something lol

item.title: Framework
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Oooh, IO. I’ve seen very few with IO, nice though. Definitely a learning experience I’m sure.

its not like im going to be implementing the reactor pattern design any time soon :P, so IO for now hahaha
